alert.note: Alert for Anderson; Bell; Falls; Freestone; Limestone; McLennan (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 02 at 6:29AM CDT by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Freestone, McLennan, eastern Bell, Limestone, Falls and Anderson Counties through 730 AM CDT... At 626 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a weakening complex of thunderstorms along a line from West and Waco, east through Mexia and toward Athens and Elkhart. Movement was southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts 40 to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Waco, Temple, Palestine, Belton, Hewitt, Robinson, Bellmead, Woodway, Mexia, Lacy-Lakeview, Marlin, McGregor, Groesbeck, Teague, Fairfield, Morgan`s Point Resort, West, Bartlett, Mart and Beverly Hills. This includes the following highways... Interstate 35 between mile markers 290 and 354. Interstate 45 between mile markers 181 and 212. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Pockets of torrential rainfall east of Highway 6 may result in localized street flooding and rises on flashy creeks. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Anderson; Bell; Falls; Freestone; Limestone; McLennan
